result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon Simmons

records.addlTxt: Transcript of Preliminary Hearing and Arraignment held 10/12/2022

4:02 PM Defendant Brandon Simmons in court, in custody.  Attorney Jacob Birenbaum in court for Brandon Simmons.  Attorney Claudia T. Johnson in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy A. Fechter sworn and testified/witness IDs deft in courtroom. Exhibit 1 - Certified copy of Milwaukee Cty JOC case 12CF849 MIOR. State objects to bindover. Defense objects to bindover for reasons stated on the record. Court finds probable cause, bound over. Defense waives reading of the Information if same count in criminal complaint. NG plea entered.
Scheduling conference scheduled for December 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Scheduling conference on December 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Letter to Clerk of Court from Atty. Birenbaum re: documents filed

Petition for appointment of counsel, affidavit of indigency and order.  Atty. Birenbaum is appointed as counsel.
Repayment to be determined at the conclusion of the case.
$100 per hour, not to exceed a total of $750 without prior approval of Court.

Petition for appointment of counsel, affidavit of indigency and order.  Atty. Jacob Birenbaum is appointed as counsel.
Repayment to be determined at the conclusion of the case. 
$100 per hour, not to exceed a total of $750 without prior approval of Court.
As to: Brandon Simmons re: Notice of Hearing
Preliminary hearing on October 12, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

5:21 PM Defendant Brandon Simmons appeared by phone, in custody.  Attorney Claudia T. Johnson appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. 
Pet for Court appointed atty mostly turned in blank, Brandon Simmon sworn and testified, Court asks def questions ref his financial capabilities. Court will appoint on this case.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Status conference on October 3, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 5, 2022 at 03:45 pm.

Deft. not eligible for public defender, request add'l time to hire counsel. Clerk to send a petition for court appt. attorney to deft.

Preliminary hearing on September 28, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Standard Conditions
Additional Conditions: 
Not possess any dangerous weapons. 
Not to consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs or possess drug paraphernalia. 
Not to be on the premises of any tavern or business whose sole purpose is the sale of alcoholic beverages.

11:22 AM Defendant Brandon Simmons appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Claudia T. Johnson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Zachary Derksen appeared by video for Brandon Simmons. Defendant advised of rights. Received complaint/waived reading. Preliminary hearing requested. Probable cause found in the complaint. Bond set.
Status conference scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
